item.title: Cassandra
item.description: start cassandra: $ cassandra -f the -f means print logs to the foreground. type ‘cqlsh’ to open the cassandra shell. $ cqlsh in the shell: HELP HELP DESCRIBE CLUSTER; DESCRIBE KEYSPACES; SHOW VERSION; no need for user, password, etc. the book is wrong about commit_log_directory, that is not a yaml property. uses port 9160

item.title: Problems With NiFi
item.description: It has a limited degree of fault tolerance. Flow files are written to one disk, they are not replicated. If that one disk crashes, the flow file is gone permanently. We work around this by using EBS (which replicates within an AZ automatically), but we shouldn’t have to. You can also work around this by leveraging kafka. While NiFi is fault tolerant (to a small degree), it is not highly available.

item.title: ZooKeeper
item.description: Start zookeeper: $ cd /share/usr/zookeeper/bin $ ./server.sh start See if it’s running: $ jps michael@michael-GA-890GPA-UD3H /share/usr/zookeeper/bin $ jps 14753 QuorumPeerMain 14773 Jps The “QuorumPeerMain” is zookeeper. It writes logs to /share/usr/zookeeper/bin/zookeeper.out The zk config is in /share/usr/zookeeper/conf/zoo.cfg The zoo.cfg file specifies a directory for zookeeper to use: dataDir=/share/var/zookeeper so we are writing to /share/var/zookeeper The default port it listens to is 2181
